p: To compare the sequences obtained from humans to those from rodents, we have only two sites with sufficient numbers of individual human-derived sequences for analysis: Ekpoma in Nigeria and Kenema in Sierra Leone. This analysis is summarized in Figure 2 and Table 1 where we note the same pattern: the sequences observed in Homo are on average earlier than those detected in Mastomys. A superimposition exists between the two viral populations, which indicates a close contact and the passage of the virus from one host to another. On the Kenema graph ( Figure 2b), the two peaks are more disjointed than in Ekpoma ( Figure 2a), probably because of a greater distance between the sites sampled within this locality. Additional analyses that do not take into account cases from Bo or Liberia show even more disjointed peaks (data not shown).
